response.overview: In 1961, a 60-year-old taxi driver stole Goya’s portrait of the Duke of Wellington from the National Gallery in London.  It was the first (and remains the only) theft in the Gallery’s history.  What happened next became the stuff of legend.
response.title: The Duke

results.name: The Duke | BFI Q&A with Jim Broadbent
Jim Broadbent & writers Richard Bean & Clive Coleman Interview
